sense.name: a building or building complex used for manufacturing
sense.examples: Most of the steel mills have closed down in that city. A fire burned down the old textile mill. You can smell the paper mill from miles away. Their family owns the flour mill in town.

sense.name: an industrial machine used in a manufacturing process
sense.examples: Many 19th-century factories were powered with a mill wheel. The mill has a rotating cutting edge to shape metal tools.

sense.name: a small device for grinding substances
sense.examples: This pepper mill is made out of good hardwood. John grinds his coffee fresh every morning with a coffee mill. The grocery store has a coffee mill with different settings of grind. Mary grinds all her spices fresh with a spice mill.

sense.name: a quality or degree of pulverization of a substance
sense.examples: They make that pasta from a flour with a courser mill. Superfine sugar has a finer mill than regular granulated sugar.
